posts.content:
This was another idea I came up with

Trying to combine Dragon Shape with Dwarven Defender

Combined with zen archer and Monk Wisdom AC it seems like this is a multi-hybrid build (melee/ranged/spells), with spellcasting abilities (undispellable), ranged abilities with zen archery, and pretty solid melee capabilities with polymorphs/dragon shape/wis AC/monk UBAB, toughness/blind fight/IC:unarmed/EP/knockdown, and damage reduction 12/- (stacking with the dragon shape for up to 52/+6 DR), 600 odd HP to boot to cast a whole bunch of spells before transforming into that dragon.

Probably the closest build I can see in the archives is Kail Pendragons's Dragon of the Stone Halls (http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 57125.html) which is a D21/DD18/M1 build. I've sacrificed 80 odd skill points in my build to be able to get one feat of EDR but I felt the build didn't need those points, and the extra HP is good to be able to survive when casting druidic spells of death with a small bonus to concentration as well. I wish I could have fit more EDR into the build but with DS wisdom requirements it was always going to be tough

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: DD DR doesn't stack with dragon DR in vanilla NWN. This build has 40/+6 DR and 12/- DR, so you have 40 DR against +0 to +5 weapons and 12 DR against +6 and above weapons.

posts.content: There is a nice discussion on DR here - https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Talk:Damage_reduction

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Archer's Belt has Damage Resistance rather than Damage Reduction, that's why it stacks with Damage Reduction effects like Ghostly Visage.
When taking damage the defensive effects applied are, in order: Damage Immunity, Damage Resistance, Damage Reduction.
DI effects stack with each other, but only the highest of DRes and DRed are applied (although DRed feats stack with each other).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Another way to have a Dragon Dwarven Defender would be something like Bard 8 / RDD 10 / DD 22.  RDD 10 gives +4 AC bonus, and DD 22 gives more Damage Reduction than DD 14.  The +2 CON from RDD would help you get EDR sooner.  I am sure it has been done several times before, but that is a build I would seriously consider playing.

That said, a skilled Druid player would do well with this build.

EDIT:  I just realized  a serious problem with my idea: there is an alignment conflict between Bard and DD.  That's very different, then.  Never mind!
